subject: Re: Re: New customer question
description_text:
Hello, back at it again. I bought the upgraded kit and the Rumble Module on
May but due to health problems i never had a chance to mount it. Can you
provide the link with the installation tutorial? Thank you.

Il giorno sab 24 mag 2025 alle ore 12:03 Federico Simoncini <
federicosic9@gmail.com> ha scritto:

> Thank you for the response.
> I will wait for the release of the Rumble Module and i'll order all
> together. What upgrades has the new Pro X? Is that all there is to it (
> https://www.simsonn.com/products/simsonn-pro-x-ultra-pedals-upgrade-kit?variant=51178646470970)?
> Or have there been some structural upgrades that we old Pro X owners can't
> get?
>
>
> Il giorno gio 22 mag 2025 alle ore 05:10 support@simsonn.com <
> support@simsonn.com> ha scritto:
>
>> Hi, we recommend purchasing the 3-pedal version as the hydraulic lever
>> upgrade is most noticeable for the throttle and clutch. Yes it will require
>> you to install the hydraulic rods and new elastomers yourself, but it's
>> pretty simple and you can ask us for a link to the installation tutorial
>> once you've purchased it. Also, our Rumble Module is expected to hit the
>> shelves this weekend or next week.
>>
>> ------------------------------
>> support@simsonn.com
>>
>>
>> *From:* Federico Simoncini <federicosic9@gmail.com>
>> *Date:* 2025-05-21 21:41
>> *To:* support@simsonn.com
>> *Subject:* Re: Re: New customer question
>> Hello, do i need to order the 3 pedals kit or just the first one? Is
>> there a guide how to mount it? Do i need to replace the hydraulic rod and
>> add the spring and elastomer? I noticed you guys added a rumble module
>> ready in the description, where will they launch? I'm in Italy so i would
>> love to save some money on shipping costs and order all together.
>>
>> Thank you.
>>
>> Il giorno lun 12 mag 2025 alle ore 07:58 support@simsonn.com <
>> support@simsonn.com> ha scritto:
>>
>>>
>>> Hello, the purpose of us launching this upgrade kit is for the users who
>>> purchased the product before to enjoy a better product experience at a
>>> cost-effective price. So the price is the lowest price we can offer, we do
>>> not rely on this product to make a profit. So we can not give a discount,
>>> thank you for your understanding!
>>> ------------------------------
>>> support@simsonn.com
>>>
>>>
>>> *From:* Federico Simoncini <federicosic9@gmail.com>
>>> *Date:* 2025-05-09 21:00
>>> *To:* support@simsonn.com
>>> *Subject:* Re: New customer question
>>> There is no discount for old customers who bought the pedals right
>>> before the upgraded version? Seems a bit lame...
>>>
>>> Thank you
>>>
>>> Il giorno gio 24 apr 2025 alle ore 04:13 support@simsonn.com <
>>> support@simsonn.com> ha scritto:
>>>
>>>> Hello, you can check the following link
>>>> https://www.simsonn.com/products/simsonn-pro-x-ultra-pedals-upgrade-kit
>>>>
>>>> ------------------------------
>>>> support@simsonn.com
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> *From:* Federico Simoncini <federicosic9@gmail.com>
>>>> *Date:* 2025-04-23 20:39
>>>> *To:* support <support@simsonn.com>
>>>> *Subject:* New customer question
>>>> Hello!
>>>> <support@simsonn.com> I ordered the Simsonn Pro X Pedals ( #SSN1056)
>>>> on the 24 January 2025.
>>>> Months passed and i'm quite happy with the Pedals, i don't like the
>>>> travel and the fell of the brake that much but i added some metal washer
>>>> for now to have a better feeling.
>>>> I just noticed that there is an upgraded version of the Pro X, is it
>>>> possible to have the upgraded kit? I ordered mine a little over 2 months
>>>> ago and would hate to be left out of the upgrade because I ordered the
>>>> "old" version.
>>>> Thank you.
>>>>
>>>>

conversations.body_text: Hi Federico Simoncini,  Please check the attached file.

Thank you. Is there any for the upgraded pedal kit?

Hi Federico Simoncini,   This is the ProX Ultra upgrade kit, designed for upgrading older pedal versions.       https://www.simsonn.com/products/simsonn-pro-x-ultra-pedals-upgrade-kit

I meant the installation tutorial
Thank you

Hi Federico Simoncini,  I’ll send you the installation guide for the VAM Pro first, and I’ll send the upgrade kit guide tomorrow once I find it.

I mounted them but they doesn't work. The software recognizes them but i
can't make them vibrate, i tried grounding the control box with the pedals
but it's the same. The Power Supply is on (green light). They just doesn't
work but i can see them in software, help please

Hi Federico Simoncini,    Please take a photo of your installation setup, including the controller box, VAM Pro motor, and pedal connections, so I can check it.  Under normal circumstances, if you have updated to the latest SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2 and upgraded the firmware to CPU1: 2.0.5, CPU2: 2.0.4, while connecting the VAM Pro to an independent power supply, and the vibration feedback interface shows that the power is connected, you should be able to click Vibration Test and the motor will vibrate as expected.

Hello. After the last update they started to work, but the Vam Pro is so
much quiter than the standard Vam, i mean, i need to use the standard one
at 10% and the Vam Pro at 100%. It changes very little in the range of
30-100%. Is it normal?

Hi Federico Simoncini,  If the VAM Pro vibration strength is appropriate, there is no issue. In fact, the vibration intensity of VAM Pro does not exactly match the progress bar; we mainly control the strength by limiting the motor current.

I can barely feel the vibration, i don't think that's how it is supposed to
be
Thank you

Hi Federico Simoncini,  Hello, your current control unit is ProX, and you purchased VAM Pro motors, correct? Please provide your current setup so I can check whether it’s the optimal configuration. VAM Pro is better suited for the ProX Ultra control board, whereas VAM has no specific requirements.

Yes. I've got the ProX and bought VAM and VAM Pro

Hi Federico Simoncini,  For the VAM Pro, the optimal vibration strength is achieved when using the ProX Ultra control unit, as its hardware supports bidirectional control of the motor.

Good morning. I bought the Prox Ultra control unit and the vibration power
increased slightly, but it didn't solve a problem I thought it would. Every
15-20 minutes the VAMs turn off and make a strange buzzing sound that only
goes away by disconnecting the standard VAM from the accelerator. To
restart them, completely disconnect the control unit and reconnect it. One
time, the VAM Pro (brake) stopped working while I was racing and it
vibrated continuously for 15 minutes.

Motor 1: standard vam
Motor 2: vam pro

Hi Federico Simoncini,  If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding
